channel.title: Google Wallet (Phone app replacing credit card)
channel.description:
http://www.google.com/wallet/ I am strongly against this idea... edit: rofl
What to do if your phone is lost or stolen Even though the Google Wallet PIN and Secure Element protect your payment card information, you should still call your issuing banks to cancel your cards.

item.source: Google Wallet (Phone app replacing credit card)

item.title: Google Wallet (Phone app replacing credit card)
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I’m not against the idea. These contact-less systems are designed for small purchases, ones under £10. It is a system designed to check if excessive payments are made, ones that go beyond what it’s intended uses are for. So your phone being stolen and then being used to try and buy things in different shops will be stopped extremely quickly.

I mean, I don’t know how useful it is, people will always carry a wallet around with them so just having a contact-less card with them will just be as easy. But I don’t think it presents many, if any significant problems.

Read full topic
item.source: Google Wallet (Phone app replacing credit card)

item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

pay.google.com

Google Pay - A better way to pay

Google Pay is the fast, simple way to pay online, in stores, and more. Everything you need at checkout and keeps your info safe and secure.

I am strongly against this idea…

edit: rofl

What to do if your phone is lost or stolen Even though the Google Wallet PIN and Secure Element protect your payment card information, you should still call your issuing banks to cancel your cards.
